title: South African defence group Denel reports $125 mln loss
text:
Denel company logo is seen at the entrance of their business divisions in Pretoria, South Africa, December 4, 2018 REUTERS/Siphiwe Sibeko/File Photo

JOHANNESBURG (Reuters) - South Africa’s struggling state-owned defence company suffered an operating loss of 1.9 billion rand ($125.3 million) for the year to March 31, it said on Friday.

“The decline in our reputation has also had a draining impact on our financial position,” Group Chief Executive Danie du Toit said in a statement, noting that revenue dropped by 36% over the period.

($1 = 15.1619 rand)
